TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit MessageEncoderFactory extends System.Object

Docs.summary: An abstract base class that represents the factory for producing message encoders that can read messages from a stream and write them to a stream for various types of message encoding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Encoding is the process of transforming a message into a sequence of bytes. Decoding is the reverse process.
Use this class if you want to implement a custom message encoder. To implement your own custom message encoder, you must provide custom implementations of the following three abstract base classes:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncodingBindingElement>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoder>
Override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory.Encoder%2A> to return an instance of your custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoder>. Then wire up your custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory> to the binding element stack used to configure the service or client by overriding the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncodingBindingElement.CreateMessageEncoderFactory%2A> method to return an instance of this factory. For more information about custom encoders, see [Data Transfer and Serialization](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-transfer-and-serialization.md).
## Examples The following code shows how to write a class that is derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory>:
[!code-csharp[S_UE_CustomTextMessageEncoder#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_customtextmessageencoder/cs/customtextmessageencoder.cs#8)] [!code-csharp[S_UE_CustomTextMessageEncoder#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_customtextmessageencoder/cs/customtextmessageencoderfactory.cs#8)]

Docs.summary: Returns a message encoder that can be used to correlate messages in session-based exchanges.
Docs.returns: The that is used in session-based exchanges of messages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A session-based message encoder can keep track the individual messages that form part of a conversation that consists of all the messages exchanged between two endpoints that are part of a session.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Encoder As MessageEncoder

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the message encoder that is produced by the factory.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MessageVersion As MessageVersion

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the message version that is used by the encoders produced by the factory to encode messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The message version can be set using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncodingBindingElement.MessageVersion%2A> property. <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> is limited to using certain versions of SOAP and WS-Addressing and is not extensible. So if these versions are not to be used, this property should be overridden to return <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
## Examples The following code illustrates how to implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageEncoderFactory.MessageVersion%2A> property:
